page.title: 18DOWNDERRY POTATOES
page.content: CLIMATIC ADVANTAGE OF COASTAL STRIP BETWEEN LOOE AND RAME HEAD ENABLES FARMERS TO SUPPLY PLYMOUTH WITH THE FINEST EARLIES AND CARRY ON THROUGH THE SEASON.THUS DOWNDERRY POTATOES WERE REPUTED, PARTICULARLY PRE-1939. 21 ACRES ARE FARMED AT TRELIDDON AND 135 BY THE SAME FARMERS ELSEWHERE.THEY ARE LOOKING TO THE FUTURE AND TESTING DIFFERENT VARIETIES FROM CONTINENTAL BREEDERS, BUT THEIR MAIN CROP IS FROM HOME-GROWN SEED AS THEY FIND THAT ACCLIMATISED SEED CROPS EARLIER.THIS YEAR THEY DUG ON MAY 17TH.VARIETIES: COLMO EARLY,"MARFONA COULD BE THE JULY-SEPTEMBER SPUD TILL THE END OF THE CENTURY",AUSONIA,DESIREE(GOING OUT),CONDOR,DIANA. OTHER LOCALLY-GROWN VEGETABLES ARE CAULIFLOWER AND BROCCOLI(ARCTIC AND CODEBRIT),SWEDES AND BRASSICAS.1985'S COLD FEBRUARY DEVASTATED THE LATTER.
